title: The Book of Mormon
author: Prophets
description: The Book of Mormon is a volume of holy scripture comparable to the Bible. It is a record of God's dealings with ancient inhabitants of the Americas and contains the fulness of the everlasting gospel. The book was written by many ancient prophets by the spirit of prophecy and revelation.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel of manners written by Jane Austen. The novel follows the character development of Elizabeth Bennet, the dynamic protagonist of the book who learns about the repercussions of hasty judgments and comes to appreciate the difference between superficial goodness and actual goodness.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism. The novel is set in Airstrip One, a province of the superstate Oceania in a world of perpetual war, omnipresent government surveillance, and public manipulation.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality told through the eyes of a young girl. The story takes place in the fictional town of Maycomb, Alabama, during the 1930s.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first novel in the Harry Potter series and Rowling's debut novel. It follows Harry Potter, a young wizard who discovers his magical heritage on his eleventh birthday, when he receives a letter of acceptance to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: Murder on the Orient Express
author: Agatha Christie
description: A detective novel featuring the Belgian detective Hercule Poirot. The story takes place on the famous Orient Express train, where Poirot must solve a murder that occurs during the journey.

title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
author: Mark Twain
description: A novel about a young boy growing up along the Mississippi River. The story is set in the fictional town of St. Petersburg, inspired by Hannibal, Missouri, where Twain lived as a boy.

title: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
author: Maya Angelou
description: The first in a seven-volume series of autobiographies. The book chronicles Angelou's early years and her struggle to overcome racism and trauma through literature and her own strong will.

title: Emma
author: Jane Austen
description: A novel about youthful hubris and romantic misunderstandings. It is set in the fictional country village of Highbury and the surrounding estates of Hartfield, Randalls, and Donwell Abbey.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: An allegorical novella that reflects events leading up to the Russian Revolution of 1917 and then on into the Stalinist era of the Soviet Union. The story features a group of farm animals who rebel against their human farmer.
